contentrichtext.text: [[File:BookMullingFol193StJohnPortrait.jpg|thumb|200px|Folio 193 of the Book of Mulling contains a portrait of [[John the Evangelist]].]] The '''Book of Mulling''' or less commonly, '''Book of Moling''' (Dublin, [[Trinity College Library]] MS 60 (A. I. 15)), is an Irish pocket [[Gospel Book]] from the late 8th century. The text collection includes the four Gospels, a liturgical service which includes the "[[Apostles' Creed]]", and in the colophon, a supposed plan of St. Moling's monastery enclosed by two concentric circles. The name derives from a former notion that the scribe was the Leinster saint [[Saint Moling|St. Moling]] (d. 697), founder of Tech-Moling ([[St. Mullins]], Co. Carlow), whose subscription occurs in the colophon at the end of St John's Gospel: ''[N]omen scriptoris Mulling dicitur''. However, the manuscript is younger and the script reveals that three scribes were involved: one for the prefaces, another for the [[synoptic gospels]] (Matthew, Mark and Luke) and a third for [[St John's Gospel]].<ref>William O'Sullivan, "Manuscripts and Palaeography." In ''A New History of Ireland vol 1. Prehistoric and Early Ireland'', ed. Dáibhí Ó Cróinín. Oxford, 2005. 535</ref> It remains possible that the manuscript was copied from an autograph manuscript of St Moling. The script is a fine Irish [[Cursive|minuscule]]. This is in fact one of the latest surviving documents to use the high style in [[Illuminated manuscripts]]. The decoration includes illuminated initials and three surviving Evangelist portraits: those of Matthew, Mark and John. Its jewelled shrine (''cumdach'') is also preserved at Trinity College. == See also == * [[List of New Testament Latin manuscripts]] * [[Book of Dimma]] == Notes == {{reflist}} ==Bibliography== *Doyle, Peter. "The Text of Saint Luke's Gospel in the Book of Mulling." ''Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy'' 73 C 6 (1973). 177-200. *Lawlor, Hugh Jackson. ''Chapters on the Book of Mulling''. Edinburgh, 1897. [http://www.archive.org/search.php?query=Book%20of%20Mulling Available from Internet Archive] *Nees, Lawrence. "The Colophon Drawing in the Book of Mulling. A Supposed Irish Monastery Plan and the Tradition of Terminal Illustration in Early Medieval Manuscripts." ''[[Cambridge Medieval Celtic Studies]]'' 5 (1983). 67-91. *Sterick, Robert D. "The plan of the evangelist portrait pages in the 'Book of Mulling'." ''Journal of the Royal Society of Antiquaries of Ireland'' 121 (1991): 27-44. [[Category:8th-century books]] [[Category:Hiberno-Saxon manuscripts]] [[Category:Irish manuscripts]] [[Category:Gospel Books]] [[Category:History of Ireland]] [[Category:Early Middle Ages]] [[Category:Trinity College, Dublin]] [[Category:Old Latin New Testament manuscripts]] [[Category:Trinity College Library, Dublin]] {{Christian-book-stub}} {{manuscript-art-stub}} {{Ireland-hist-stub}}
